Contradict fact: The claim that Ethiopia seized cash from TPLF officials fleeing the country is contradicted by the fact that the image shared with the claim is traced back to a cash seizure in Brazil in 2017.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by referring to the TPLF members as a "mafia" and suggesting that there is a large amount of hidden money that will be uncovered.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by falsely linking the seized cash to the TPLF, when in fact it is from a completely unrelated incident in Brazil.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a false connection between the seized cash and the TPLF officials.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the seized cash is connected to the TPLF officials without any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the image of the seized cash is from a completely unrelated incident in Brazil and has no connection to the TPLF officials.
